intro: Psychotria daphnoides var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
